intro: Pentanema caspicum, commonly known as the Caspian pentanema, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Pentanema caspicum is often found in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and in mountainous areas.
